verbs.description: perhorresce (third-person singular simple present perhorresces, present participle perhorrescing, simple past and past participle perhorresced)

entries.meaning: (rare, formal, transitive, intransitive) To shudder (at). [from 19th c.]
examples: This we may ascribe to the ‘d—d nonsense’ perhorresced by Mr. Lockhart.
